description: Part three storey rear extension (following demolition of the existing three storey extension), part two storey rear infill extension to existing flats; formation of rear terrace x 2 at first floor level (Joint Application)
subdivision_of_building: Lower ground floor - Unit 1 (No.49); Unit 2 (Rear of No.51); Upper ground floor - Unit 2 (No.49); Unit 4 (Rear of No.51); First floor - Unit 3 (No.49); Unit 6 (Rear of No.51).
decision_conditions: The development permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.
Reason: In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended).

| The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with drawing numbers:  22-004-E01, 22-004-E02, 22-004-E03, 22-004-E04, 22-004-E05, 22-004-E06, 22-004-E07, 22-004-E08, 22-004-P01, 22-004-P02B Rev B, 22-004-P03, 22-004-P04, 22-004-P05, 22-004-P06, 22-004-P07, 22-004-P08, Planning, Design and Access Statement dated September 2022.
Reason: For the avoidance of doubt, and in the interests of proper planning.

| The materials to be used for the development shall match the appearance of those of the existing, unless where stated on either the submitted application form or the drawings / plans as listed in Condition (2).

Reason: To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings, in accordance with policies 7.4 & 7B of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013), policy D3 of the London Plan (2021) and policies 1.1 (g), 2.1 (c) and 2.10 of the Adopted Development (Core) Strategy 2012.

| A minimum of fifteen (15) cycle parking space shall be provided on site in the rear garden area of the building in accordance with adopted standards of the London Plan (2021). Such provision shall be retained permanently.

Reason: To provide adequate facilities for cyclists, in accordance with Ealing Sustainable Transport SPG (2013), policy T5 of the London Plan (2021) and National Planning Policy Framework 2021 - section 9.

| No part of the roof of the extension shall be used as or altered to form a balcony, roof garden, roof terrace or similar amenity area, unless where stated on either the submitted application form or the drawings / plans as listed in Condition (2).

Reason: To protect residential amenity, in accordance with policies 1.1 & 2.1 of the Ealing Development Strategy (2012), policies 7.4 & 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policies D3 and D4 of the London Plan (2021) and the National Planning Policy Framework (2021).
| The infill and rear extensions hereby approved shall be carried out in their entirety, and their development shall occur at the same time.
Reason: To protect the living conditions of occupants of the properties in accordance with policies 7B and 7.4 of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013) and Policy D6 of the London Plan (2021).

| Notwithstanding the provisions of Article 3 of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) (England) Order 2015 (or any subsequent amendment, revision or new Order) no windows or other openings (other than those shown on the submitted plans) shall be formed in the walls or roof of the building permitted.

Reason: To protect residential amenity, in accordance with policies 1.1 & 1.2 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies 7.4 and 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policies D1 and D4 of the London Plan (2021), and the National Planning Policy Framework (2021).
| The proposed windows to the side elevation on drawing number 22-004-P07 shall at all times be obscure-glazed.

Reason: To protect residential amenity, in accordance with policies 1.1 & 2.1 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies 7.4 & 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policies D1 and D4 of the London Plan (2021), and the National Planning Policy Framework (2021).

| The residential units hereby approved shall at no time be converted from C3 residential to a C4 small HMO, notwithstanding the provisions of Schedule 2 Part 3 Class L of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) Order 2015 (or any order revoking and re-enacting that Order) without express planning permission having first been granted by the Local Planning Authority.

Reason: To prevent the overdevelopment of the site and to safeguard the living conditions of adjoining properties and visual appearance of the building, in accordance with policies 7.4 and 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policies 7.4 and of the London Plan (2016) and the National Planning Policy Framework (20121.
